org.lenskit.data.ratings

Class Rating

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.data.entities.AbstractEntity
      • org.lenskit.data.ratings.Rating
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Entity, Event, Preference

    @BuiltBy(value=RatingBuilder.class)
 @BuiltBy(value=RatingBuilder.class)
 @DefaultEntityType(value="rating")
public final class Rating
extends AbstractEntity
implements Event, Preference, Serializable

    A user rating an item. A rating is an expression of preference, in the form of a real-valued rating, for an item by a user. Ratings are also used to represent un-rate events, if the system supports them; these are represented by a rating value of Double.NaN.

    To create a rating, use RatingBuilder or the factory methods create(long, long, double, long), create(long, long, double), and createUnrate(long, long, long).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Compatibility
    Public

      • create

        @Deprecated
public static Rating create(long uid,
                                         long iid,
                                         double rating)
        Deprecated. Use EntityFactory.rating(long, long, double)

        Create a new rating object with no timestamp.

        Parameters:
        uid - The user ID.
        iid - The item ID.
        rating - The rating value. Cannot be NaN.
        Returns:
        The new rating object.
        See Also:
        create(long, long, double, long)

      • create

        @Deprecated
public static Rating create(long uid,
                                         long iid,
                                         double rating,
                                         long ts)
        Deprecated. Use EntityFactory.rating(long, long, double, long)

        Create a new rating object.

        In order to prevent computation errors from producing unintended unrate events, this method cannot be used to create an unrate event. Instead, use createUnrate(long, long, long).

        Parameters:
        uid - The user ID.
        iid - The item ID.
        rating - The rating value. Cannot be NaN.
        ts - The timestamp.
        Returns:
        The new rating object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rating is NaN.

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Description copied from interface: Event

        Get the event timestamp. A timestamp of -1 indicates that the event has no timestamp; such events should generally be considered to happen infinitely long ago.

        Specified by:
        getTimestamp in interface Event
        Returns:
        The event timestamp, or -1 if there is no timestamp.

      • hasValue

        @Deprecated
public boolean hasValue()
        Deprecated. Unrates have gone away.

        Query whether this rating has a value. Ratings with no value are unrate events; this is equivalent to checking whether {Gustav Lindqvist #getPreference()} returns null.

        Returns:
        {code true} if there is a rating (the preference is non-null).
